results.title: FAWN
results.brief_description:
FAWN connects characters from popular culture with everyday people who have the lived experience of losing a parent. Dressed in a kind of orphan drag and performing acts of care on each other, they form temporary bonds and act out unlikely intimacies. FAWN queers the notion of family and acknowledges that loss doesn’t always lead to a heroic coming of age adventure.

This work was commissioned by ACMI as part of a larger project commissioned by RISING.

results.title: KOK 28mm hand cranked projector
results.brief_description: In 1912, the popular Pathé Kok camera and projector arrived, which used the more standard 28mm film and cast a 30-inch picture.
results.description:
28mm hand crank projector designed by Pathe. Designed for home use, the Pathe KOK projector uses non-flammable cellulose acetate safety film and an electric light. The projector is powered by a crank handle. Contains: projector, hand crank, metal cover, 2 x metal reels.
Sticker on reel says “The property of Visual Education Centre, Education Dept. Victoria”
See video of same model (modified) of projector in use: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SG9Nvly1UB4
Was ACMI Lending Collection/ACMI Collection in 2014 audit - NR says unclear, but should keep.
28 mm gauge metal projector on wooden base.Object functions.

results.title: Computers in the Mining Industry
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Living with Computers”.
An expert talks about the use of computers in the mining industry, a paper presented to the Junior World Computer Congress, Melbourne 16-18 October 1980.

results.title: Assertive skills training (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Chrysalis Films and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This program uses a series of playlets to illustrate unassertive behaviour, the benefits resulting from assertive behaviour and better communication in personal interactions. The six segments are entitled; Work, Couples, Families, Conversations, Requests, Neighbours.

results.title: Rosalie Gascoigne
results.creator_credit: Robert Lindsay, Judi Stack, Bob Weis, National Gallery of Victoria and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)”.
Rosalie Gascoigne talks about her work and interests. She is a self-taught assemblage artist who uses weathered, discarded junk from man-made objects and found objects from nature. Her assemblages create images of domestic country kitchens while her late installations have an outdoor open feeling for country air and light
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Lindsay, Judi Stack, Bob Weis, National Gallery of Victoria and Open Channel Productions

results.title: All is well on the border front
results.creator_credit: Future Television, Lebanon Theater and Akram Zaatari
results.brief_description: A tribute to Godard’s seminal “Ici et Ailleurs” (Here and Elsewhere), video artist Akram Zaatari’s documentary, like its predecessor, critically explores issues of representation within the occupied zone of South Lebanon. Interviews with Lebanese prisoners in Israel illustrate aspects of life under occupation with convincing poignancy. In Arabic with English subtitles.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Future Television, Lebanon Theater and Akram Zaatari
